definition: to totally prohibit/to put an end to
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: Smoking is forbidden in this office.
You are not supposed to play football in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 在教室里是禁绝踢足球的。

sentences.english: Writing letters to families should be forbidden, this is to break all troubles of life.
sentences.chinese: 禁绝士卒和亲人通信，以断绝他们思家的念头。

sentences.english: Ban the songs of Zheng and keep away from glib -tongued men.
sentences.chinese: 禁绝郑国的乐曲，疏远奸佞的小人。

sentences.english: By the end of 1952, the Opium wade has completelydisappeared.
sentences.chinese: 到1952年底，全省范围的鸦片烟毒基本禁绝。

sentences.english: The soldiers were prohellobited from leaving camp after dark.
sentences.chinese: 入夜后士兵禁绝离开营房。

sentences.english: Sometimes! I need music to reduce off my own thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 有时刻，我须要音乐来禁绝自己痴心胡想。

sentences.english: During this fast they abstain from the gratification of every appetite and passion whatever.
sentences.chinese: 绝食之时，他们禁绝了食欲和其他欲愿的满足。

definition: to lift a ban/to lift a curfew
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
to violate a prohibition or ban/prohibited/illicit
